qas.question: What is the name of the last period of classical Japanese history?
The Heian period is named after what city?
What does heian mean in Japanese?
What was the name of the prominent clan during the Heian period?
The Heian period was known for what types of art?
What period marks the end of Japanese history?
What Japanese dynasty was named after the city of Heian-kyo?
What Chinese influences where waning in the Heian period?
What was declining along with the imperial court?
What family did many Japanese Emperors belong to?

context: <b6_0>The <a0_0><b5_0>Heian<b6_0/><a0_0/> period<b5_0/> (平安時代, Heian jidai?) is the last division of classical Japanese history, running from 794 to 1185. The period is named after the capital city of <a1_0>Heian-kyō<a1_0/>, or modern Kyōto. It is the period in Japanese history when <b7_0>Buddhism, Taoism<b7_0/> and other Chinese influences were at their height. The Heian period is also considered the peak of the Japanese imperial court and noted for its <b8_0>art, especially <a4_0>poetry and literature<b8_0/><a4_0/>. Although the Imperial House of Japan had power on the surface, the real power was in the hands of the <a3_0>Fujiwara<a3_0/> clan, a powerful aristocratic family who had intermarried with the imperial family. Many emperors actually had mothers from the <b9_0>Fujiwara<b9_0/> family. Heian (平安?) means "<a2_0>peace<a2_0/>" in Japanese.
